Package backEnd

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • backEnd.Driver
  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    The Driver class contains all the code to take input from the user so that they can create their personal task list. The runCalendar() method controls all of the main options, which are then split into their own respective methods.
    Author:
    Evan Nadelbach

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method calls the runCalendar() method.
        Parameters:
        args - is the main String array argument.

      • runCalendar

        public static boolean runCalendar()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        The runCalendar() method runs everything related to the user's task list. It creates the task list that stores the users events, takes input from the user, and will run through whatever option the user chooses. This method contains all of the options for the user to select from, which include creating a new task, showing current tasks, setting the priority of an existing task, completing a task, showing completed tasks, and removing tasks.
        Returns:
        true if the method ran successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the program was interrupted.

      • createNewTask

        public static void createNewTask​(backEnd.TaskList list,
                                 java.util.Scanner sc)
        This method creates a new task for the user's task list.
        Parameters:
        list - contains the user's list.
        sc - contains the user's scanner object.
